definition: to keep sb company/to accompany

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
partner/companion/comrade/associate/to accompany
erhua variant of 做伴[zuo4 ban4]

sentences.english: I'm usually home and I'd love the company.
sentences.chinese: 我通常在家，也喜欢游人做伴。

sentences.english: For example, we now have e-friends to help us and keep us company.
sentences.chinese: 比如说我们现在有电子朋友帮忙，给我们做伴。

sentences.english: Colleen was a loner, except for her sister’s company.
sentences.chinese: 除了和妹妹做伴之外，科琳是个独行侠。

sentences.english: At that time there had been lots of other bears to keep him company.
sentences.chinese: 那时候，还有很多泰迪熊和他做伴。

sentences.english: He has been retired for many years spent at home and a civet cats keep company.
sentences.chinese: 他已经退休多年，在家和一只花狸猫做伴。

sentences.english: Together, the two nobodies can enjoy each other's company and their shared anonymity.
sentences.chinese: 两个小人物喜欢彼此做伴和共享的绰号。

sentences.english: I only hope to accompany you through the present and future.
sentences.chinese: 我只愿和你做伴，从现在一直到未来。

sentences.english: Let us the company live Xiaoxiao Sasa.
sentences.chinese: 让我们红尘做伴活的潇潇洒洒。

sentences.english: The child is very glad for her company.
sentences.chinese: 这个孩子很高兴和她做伴。
